fmCIRSRexsHCF2u6i8iLAg.text: Stopped in here looking for a place to get out of the Christmas-time rush at the Strip and rest our feet.  We would have done better to eat virtually anywhere else.  Service was competent, but extremely rushed (I don't think real words were exchanged - just points and grunts).  Inexplicably, the pizza crust was overcooked, while the rest of the slice was doughy.  We had the Greek pizza, complete with an almost inedibly salty garlic sauce.  Each slice came with one huge tomato, and when it fell off (as it inevitably did), the dough beneath was practically raw.  At least it was better than our friends' margherita pizza, which had virtually no toppings at all. The beer selection was decent, but my husband's draft was flat.  There are a million great food options in the Strip - this is not one of them.

UPvsiiinkuHszOuuUp0x6w.text: Really, EXTREMELY disappointing experience!  I took my Mom here because I'd been years ago and had some very good pizza.  Granted it was two days before Christmas (we were doing our manic holiday food shopping extravaganza), so it was of course extremely crowded.  Once we were seated and our order taken (which, not surprisingly due to the crowd, took a while), our food came out relatively quickly.    Let me be clear, this review is negative for one reason and one reason only.  Our pizza was burnt, charred, and the crust was almost entirely inedible (see pic).  The bottom of the pizza and crust were dark brown/black.  And, when I asked our waiter if this was normal, he said yes.  He asked if we wanted to send it back and have another pizza made for us, but considering how much shopping we had to do and only a few hours to do it in, that was simply not feasible.  What should have happened is that our pizza should have been comped, or we should have been offered a credit or something!  But, instead of anything being offered or any apology for an obviously overcooked pie, he "apologized" by saying "I'm sorry that you did not like the pizza".  Not "I'm sorry that your pizza was burned beyond the point of consumption, here's what I can do for you...". I did see a look of panic - he obviously realized that it was a botched pizza.  For the life of me, I simply cannot understand why the waiter insisted that the pizza was supposed to be burned. If I was waiting, I wouldn't have let that pie get to the table in the first place. I looked at all of the other tables, and no one else's pizza was burnt or even overly brown.  There was a mistake in the kitchen and it was our waiter's job to send it back or offer to do something about it.  In the end, my Mom and I had to eat something, so we pretty much just scraped the topping off of our pizza and left the crust and most of the bottom. Also, three of the pieces were completely inedible, so we didn't even touch them.   I rarely leave a one star review, and we still tipped the waiter 20%.  Although, I usually leave 30%-40% around the holidays, so he missed out.  But, this was simply a horrible experience.  And, considering the amount of great restaurants in the Strip, I think I can safely say that I will not be back and not be recommending Bella Notte anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Notte - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The topping was good, but the crust was inedible.

k3ME5UqsYM1Po6eY6hoL9A.text: We loved the pizza and the service! We had a large pepperoni pizza and a medium olive and sausage pizza, they are huge! We also had a buffalo chicken sandwich it was as big as two sandwiches! There where 8 of us and we have a whole other meal left. We also, shared a "sex on the beach", they did not skimp on the booze! I would eat here the next time I am on the area!

pAe3HZp_bh3MW3a43yMYCw.text: Good for a quick pizza if that is what you are looking for. We tried the Greek pizza and white pizza. The white pizza was bland and I wouldn't get it again. The Greek pizza would be suffering from the same bland taste but fortunately the greek olives and feta cheese toppings added some good flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Notte - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. White and Greek pizzas

s_Wl2Ulpi3qcRK1L0xdjlw.text: Ordered a white pizza which was flavorless.just bread topped with cheese.it does not take much to add a little flavor punch to a pizza..not to mention the burnt crust which took away the lil taste there was. Also ordered a bleu cheese apple walnut salad-for $9 its such a fraud..literally 20 spinach leaves topped with chewy gummy mozzarella...spinach leaves were not fresh,clearly rotting at the edges. Our silverware had old old rock hard cheese sticking on them..yuck!! Have to say our server was noce though. Not coming back!

piC8XgMLvdmKtIgfseJtqg.text: I'm the jerk who goes to the pizza place and gets a meatball sub.  But I had food jealousy and I had to!!  I saw a waitress with a tray full of them and then I watched this guy bite into it and it was done, I had to have it!    Was it worth it?  HECK YEAH IT WAS!  There's nothing like a thick Italian bread bun with 4 heaping balls of meat, enough marinara sauce to satisfy my sauce obsession and melted moz cheese.  Does that talk you outta a pizza now?  It was REALLY good and worth every bite.  I did not get food jealousy over my friends pizza.    Will I go back and order the Pizza next time?  Maybe, unless I see a Meatball Sub go by again, then all bets are off!

hI2k0zG0gfDDFo9piA86iA.text: Best calzones ever!  They're huge and jam packed with the freshest ingredients. Their service is great as well.. Oh, and" leave the gun, take the cannolis". They're so good!

DY_TcgBzn35JXA7r0G24Ug.text: We stopped in while stocking up on spices at Penn Mac. Here's the run down:  1. Service:  My husband asked our server what beers were on tap. She referred to the menu, but could not tell him a single one. Nor did she offer to find out. 2. Hygiene: Outside table was filthy. Literally. Nasty. Cleaned it with a baby wipe. 3. Service: Food took a really, really long time. Mediocre at best. And that is being fairly generous. 4. Food: Ordered an Italian sausage hoagie ($9). Sausage was bland, roll was enormous, and very little in the way of toppings. Came with Ruffle chips. Husband ordered the 16" Greek pizza ($12.50) but no meat came on it. And there was no gyro meat, so he added Italian sausage for $2. 5. Hygiene again: Restrooms- yuck. Don't do it. 6. Pluses: Bloody Mary was ok. Diet Coke was good. Pizza crust was good.  Bottom line: seems to be a tourist trap that spent all its money on prime location and thus has to scrimp on everything else. Bummed we went there.

hrYfdu80v__RTYQR4zZ2QA.text: Oh,man! This place has perfect pizza! Whenever we're in Pittsburgh, we try one or two places we've never been to. One of them has to be a pizza joint. One particular visit a few years back, we already had pizza at a place downtown and thought it was the best we've had in Pittsburgh, but then we came to Bella Notte later in the day. MM MM . . . Pizza Heaven!  First, I ordered a beer. I love porter or stout and asked what they had on tap. Was recommended the Edmund Fitzgerald. Loved it! Found a new favorite. Next, we ordered a couple different pizzas. Mine was mostly peppers, onions, olives. My niece's was pepperoni and sausage.  My pizza was very good, but when I took a bite out of the pepperoni/sausage slice, it was perfection. The pizza was nice and hot. When the bottom of the crust slightly snapped on the first bite, it was like a pizza dream come to life. The pepperoni and sausage were not cheap quality. Very tasty. Another reviewer on here said the flavor was close to Domino's.  GTFOH! Domino's is junk. Not even CLOSE! That person must be a smoker who can't taste anything, or they were drunk.   After that fateful day, every year when we come to see the Steelers play (several times each season), or we're here to visit family and hang out, Bella Notte is on the list. In fact, I'll be in town at the end of May and my sister will be with me. She's gluten intolerant and can't eat the pizza. But, that's not my problem. I'm getting some of this for sure!

2cv2rga5MJD8gd9Qo3T0AQ.text: At this places Founders night for PCBW we went to find them with two founders beers on taps and a private event booking the entire restaurant. We were told we could sit outside on the dingy patio furniture but decided to go elsewhere. Poor planning and False advertising = 1 star.

BC0pbtMq7mNRZo2N7zGkJg.text: Customer service (2/5): "hello... is anybody there?!?" It took a couple of minutes for someone to take our to-go order. The staff wasn't rude but they wasn't friendly either. They look like they were watching the clock and couldn't wait to get off work. Bella Notte seemed like the last place they wanted to be.   Food (3/5) : It taste extremely average! If I was blindfolded and was given three different pizzas to try, definitely wouldn't be able to notice anything distinct besides the thickness of the crush. I only eat cheese pizza so the main part of the pizza for me is the bread and the sauce. The sauce was very regular but I loved the thick crush! I got a half cheese and half pepperoni (my husband ate the other side). That was the first time I saw a restaurant cut up the pepperoni into thin slices... kinda odd but I guess that is their signature. I husband didn't really like it that much.  I would give this restaurant 2 stars but since they made such a thick crust, that deserved another star.

fJFjtd2DCtP96XGOoZo8PA.text: Excellent pizza, crunchy crust with fab flavor. Single slice was only four bucks. Unreal beer selection, rail bender had a nice close. Service was friendly and fast. Hogie italian stallion was off the hook. Casual atmosphere and great food/ beer. Price for all this was under about $20 for 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Notte - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 44 beers! :-)

8-sp7mHU6VBstbLr3NAaRA.text: Wondering for the first time in the Strip. Food smells made me remember it was lunch. So I popped in here. Good beer selection. Surprised to see Great Lakes beer being offered. Yes instead of bloody mary. Pizza that was coming out of kitchen looked good. So I had mom and dad meet here for some good pizza. It did no disappoint. Sure the order was pepperoni and sausage but we got sausage and pepperoncini. I still enjoyed the pie. Hate to say. East Coast pizza is just a little better.

_iXeJksSWoIgjhfq4xZmPA.text: My Wife, Daughter and I made the 150 mile round trip to shop the Strip District. We have done this many times before, but always on a Saturday.Today, we managed to all be off on a Monday so off we went. One thing that was on the list was to have lunch at this restaurant.  We went in just after Noon and were immediately greeted and seated. A couple of minutes later, the waitress took our drink orders and just a few minutes after that, our food orders. Now, we are only at about 12:15. The ladies ordered the speciality pizza of the day and I ordered a sandwich.  12:45 and we were still waiting for our orders. just before 12:50, we were served our food. The pizza was very good and did seem to have been served hot and fresh. The sandwich, on the other hand, had an issue. It felt as though it had been holding under a heat lamp for a while. The bottom of the bun was no problem but, the top was so hot, I could not touch it for more than 5 minutes.  All in all, we ended up being here for right around an hour. The wait time was wholly unacceptable considering that there seemed to be ample personnel for a place that was only half full, or less. The waitress was very nice, but, never once gave us any information on why our order was taking so long to prepare.  In summary, the food was good, tasty and hot. The waitress was friendly but lacking just a little in the customer service end. Really no complaint about her since it wasn't her fault that it took so long to get the order prepared.  With all of the choices in this area, it really isn't likely that we would return to Bella Notte.

hgefBNMpUV6Uc1YOF1Oo5g.text: Love coming here for pizza and beer. Never had a bad pizza. Service is attentive and location is great. I've gotten the buffalo chicken pizza in the past which was incredible but today got pizza with sausage ricotta and onion, crust is perfect and the sausage is crumbled not slices which in my opinion is the way to go, sauce isn't too sweet like some other pizzas I've gotten in pgh. Ricotta is so fresh and the onion was cooked perfectly. It can get pretty busy around peak strip shopping times but I tend to come at off peak to avoid the wait. Tons of beers on tap that my husband loves but I keep it simple. Can't say enough good things about this place!

yKdnB1pb6C716st7CU0sVg.text: This pizza is really close to being a Digiornio pizza just with better cheese.  I ordered a medium, which they call an 8 cut...because they think number of slices somehow equals a size, which it doesn't.  I don't understand why so many Pittsburgh pizza shops use this standard of listing the number of slices as the size when it doesn't mean anything and you can cut any size pizza into any amount of slices that you want.  Chalk it up to yinzer IQ I guess.    The crust of this pizza looks and tastes just like a frozen Digiornio crust.  They cook the pie directly on the deck of the oven, which this time was VERY dirty and the bottom of my pizza ended up with a whole bunch of nasty burned black remains from other peoples pizza because the pizzaman was too lazy to just clean the oven as he used it.  Despite cooking directly on the brick this pizza is far from crunchy.  They use corn meal on the bottom of their pies which wouldn't be too bad if they weren't using way too much of it...so you end up with a dusty dirty pizza bottom in general. The pizza itself was way too thick and most of the dough did not cook at all.  The top of the dough and the bottom of the pie both LOOKED to be cooked enough, but the taste would beg to dffer.  The actual flavor of the dough is pretty good, I taste some decent yeasty fermented goodness with a fairly nice bready taste.  If it were a better consistency and it weren't so ungodly thick than it may taste good.  To my delight hey use a pretty healthy portion of sauce, unfortunately the sauce tastes obnoxious and cheap.  It is pretty obvious they are using the lowest quality tomatoes they can get and then adding a ton of sugar and garlic powder to try to cover it up.  The consistency is a medium thickness and slightly on the watery side, definitely no signs of actual chunks of tomatoes.  It tastes like the kind of pizza sauce that you would expect from skating rink pizza.  Once again the name Digiornio comes to mind.    The cheese is a mid grade cheese, it melts fairly well but doesn't have all that much flavor.  They are using a bit more of it than I would like but not so much that it ruins the pie.  The cheese was applied somewhat lazily and a lot of it ended up in the middle of the pie as opposed to distributed across the whole pie.    In general this is just another pretty bad pizza, mostly because of the sauce and doughy dough.   I give it a 4 out of 10.
